chunk: Hummus with veggie fingers recipe Your baby will love this homemade hummus. With no added salt, it’s a great snack for the whole family. Age: 12 months or older Prep: 10 mins Cook: None Portions: 4 (approx) Ingredients - 120g chickpeas (½ canned in water, drained) - 1 tbsp lemon juice - ½ to 1 garlic clove, peeled - ½ tsp ground cumin - 1½ tbsp water - 2 tsp olive oil - Approx 24 sugar snap peas, washed Method Put all the ingredients, apart from the sugar snap peas, into a blender or food processor and blend into a smooth paste. Serve with the sugar snap peas (or any other vegetables good for dipping). If you have older children in the family it’s a great snack for them to enjoy, and adults too. Any leftovers should be covered and kept in the fridge (for up to 2 to 3
title: Hummus With Veggie Fingers
description: Your baby will love this homemade hummus. With no added salt, it’s a great snack for the whole family.

chunk: in the family it’s a great snack for them to enjoy, and adults too. Any leftovers should be covered and kept in the fridge (for up to 2 to 3 days). Information: You can also use wholemeal pitta bread or wholemeal toast fingers for dipping. Weaning tip From 12 months, your child should be having 3 meals a day. They may also need 2 healthy snacks in between.
